com.sri.kernel.modules
Class DefaultModule

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.kernel.modules.DefaultModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Module
Direct Known Subclasses:
Beacon, Health, Httpd, Magellan, Mail, Modutils, OOPic, Sample, Speech, SRML, UserPanel
public class DefaultModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module

This provides a generic interface to the Module class. It not only provides basic implementation of the Module methods, but also provides helper methods to implementing modules.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Constructor Detail

DefaultModule

public DefaultModule()
Default constructor. Does nothing. Implementing modules that have dependencies and use the provided addDependency method must make addDpendency calls in their constructor

Method Detail

initModule

public boolean initModule(ModuleData md)
Initializes the module with the provided ModuleData. This is called when the module is loaded by the system. This method does not need to be overridden if the module does not need to initialize any objects. If SRML elements are provided by the implementing module, calls to addSRMLElement should be made in an override of this method.

Specified by:
initModule in interface Module
Parameters:
md - The given ModuleData.
Returns:
True if the module has successfully initialized, false otherwise. This method always returns true.

cleanupModule

public void cleanupModule()
No Action Taken. Called when the module is unloaded.

Specified by:
cleanupModule in interface Module

runDiagnostic

public boolean runDiagnostic(int level,
                             java.io.PrintStream ps)
Performs a diagnostic at the given [level] using the Print Stream [ps] for status reports. This implemention simply returns true.

Specified by:
runDiagnostic in interface Module
Parameters:
level - The level of the diagnostic.
ps - The print stream to which messages should be written.
Returns:
true
See Also:
Diagnostics

getSRMLElements

public java.util.Vector getSRMLElements()
Returns the list of SRML Elements provided by the implementing module.

Specified by:
getSRMLElements in interface Module
Returns:
The SRML Elements provided.

getDependencies

public java.util.Vector getDependencies()
Returns the list of dependencies needed by the implementing module.

Specified by:
getDependencies in interface Module
Returns:
The dependencies.

getNeededBy

public java.util.Vector getNeededBy()
This module is needed by the returned list of modules.

Specified by:
getNeededBy in interface Module
Returns:
The modules which need this module.

addNeededBy

public void addNeededBy(java.lang.String moduleName)
A function used by the module loader, called when a dependency is requested by another module. Implementing modules do not call this method. It is for use by the module system.

Specified by:
addNeededBy in interface Module
Parameters:
moduleName - The name of the module which needs this module.

configurationChange

public void configurationChange()
Will be called when a configuration option has been changed at runtime. This method is not used at this time

Specified by:
configurationChange in interface Module

addSRMLElement

protected void addSRMLElement(SRMLElement element)
A utility function to register SRML Elements. This should be called from the implementing modules initModule method.

Parameters:
element - The element to register

addDependency

protected void addDependency(java.lang.String moduleName,
                             java.lang.String version)
A utility function to register a dependency named by [moduleName] and at version [version]

Parameters:
moduleName - The module name of the dependency.
version - The base version number.
